e4: Adopting the new policy ensures that the company adheres to ethical reporting standards, fostering trust and integrity in its financial disclosures. Though it might lead to initial confusion among investors accustomed to the adjusted figures, clear communication and education about the change can mitigate misunderstandings. In the long term, this transparency will benefit all stakeholders by providing a more accurate depiction of the company’s financial health, potentially avoiding legal issues and fostering more sustainable investor relations.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, transparency, and fairness. It should present financial figures without manipulation, ensuring that all stakeholders, regardless of their level of sophistication, have access to the same quality of information. The policy should comply with legal standards and regulatory requirements, and should facilitate neither misinformation nor misinterpretation. Considerations may include the implications of reporting changes on less informed investors and the method of communicating such changes to prevent potential market distortions or unfair advantages.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to educate and inform investors about the transition to the new, unbiased reporting policy to mitigate any confusion or misinterpretations. Additionally, I would inquire about the anticipated short-term impacts on stock prices and investor relations, and what strategies are in place to handle any potential negative reactions in the financial markets. Finally, I'd seek clarity on the timeline for implementing the new policy and any contingency measures for unforeseen challenges during this transition.
